meanings.definition: Tediously long or dull in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The prosy lecture seemed to never end.
meanings.sent2: Her prosy stories always put me to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The prosy history lesson made the students yawn.
meanings.sent4: The prosy novel dragged on like a slow-moving river.
meanings.sent5: The prosy presentation felt like watching paint dry.

meanings.definition: A person who speaks or writes tediously long or dull.
meanings.sent1: The prosy at the meeting kept talking without pause.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office prosy for her lengthy emails.
meanings.sent3: The prosy in the group always had a captive audience - of one.
meanings.sent4: He was a pro at being a prosy, never running out of words.
meanings.sent5: The prosy's monologue was like a never-ending storybook.

meanings.definition: A tedious or dull speech or piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's prosy put the students to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The prosy in the book made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The prosy of the play turned the audience into statues.
meanings.sent4: The prosy of the speech echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The prosy of the article was like reading a dictionary.
